result.execSummary:
The defendant Zachary Peter Terpstra was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: DOC Collect.  If discharged from extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Zachary Peter Terpstra

records.addlTxt: 9:49 AM Defendant Zachary Peter Terpstra in court, in custody.  Attorney Peter R. Moyers in court for Zachary Peter Terpstra.  Prosecuting attorney Mary Elizabeth Bricco in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant pleads guilty. Court finds the defendant guilty. Presentence investigation waived. Court orders 3 years in the Wisconsin State Prison System comprised of 1 year of initial confinement followed by 2 years of extended supervision concurrent with any other sentence.  Defendant is eligible for Substance Abuse Program and Challenge Incarceration Program. Costs DOC collect. Sentence credit 126 days.
Status conference on September 15, 2022 at 09:15 am.

9:52 AM Prosecuting attorney Mary Elizabeth Bricco in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Zachary Peter Terpstra in court, in custody.  Attorney Peter R. Moyers appeared by video for Zachary Peter Terpstra.
Status conference scheduled for September 15, 2022 at 09:15 am.
Calendar call on July 21, 2022 at 09:45 am.
